alert.note: Alert for Ashland; Bayfield; Douglas (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 18 at 2:31PM CST until February 18 at 3:00PM CST by NWS Duluth
info.description: The National Weather Service in Duluth MN has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Bayfield County in northwestern Wisconsin... East central Douglas County in northwestern Wisconsin... Western Ashland County in northwestern Wisconsin... * Until 300 PM CST. * At 230 PM CST, a dangerous snow squall was located near Iron River, or 37 miles east of Superior, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Extremely poor visibility in heavy snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts greater than 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. This affects US Highway 2 from Brule to Ashland. Locations impacted include... Ashland, Washburn, Sanborn, Iron River, Cable, Barnes, Barksdale, Bayfield, Drummond, Marengo, Port Wing, La Pointe, Madeline Island, Ino, Herbster, Town of Delta, Benoit, Namekagon Lake, Namekagon, and Red Cliff. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead to accidents. Reduce your speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions.
